description: We we're visiting the city for a month and made it here several times. The subs are huge!!!! So plan on sharing if you do not have a big appetite! Galic sauce was very good too.
author: Heidi P.

description: I've ordered sandwiches here many times, and their sandwiches are great, but I will never eat there again after today. I ordered a sandwich online via Yelp for takeout. I understand the estimate says 30-40 minutes. However, the place was dead when I walked in. A lunch rush came in right after me; I had ordered before every person in line even walked in the door and half of them got served before me. This is after a 20% tip and identifying myself at the register. A meter maid was circling my car like a vulture because it almost ran out of the 25 minutes I put on it waiting so long for a 6" sub - no drink, no chips, no desserts - just a single regular size sub. The staff acted like I was an entitled white guy for wanting to be served in order and in a timely fashion for a simple order for which I tipped 20% and almost cost me the price of a parking ticket to boot.
author: Steve S.

description: Love coming to this place ! Delicious sandwiches right in Noe Valley. They have a great selection and sandwiches are fresh ! it may seem pricey, but not as pricey as other sandwich shops in SF.
author: Natalie L.

description:
Great selection, friendly staff and good quality food. Perfect for a quick bite.
They also serve Mitchell's ice cream!
author: Smruthi N.

description: Still going strong.  In a neighborhood in transition, Rami and crew deliver.  Ice cream/ meatball subs// Matt Cain// anything with bacon or pastrami. Thx for keeping neighborhood real
author: David G.

description:
Got a scoop of Mitchell's chocolate ice cream and a TBA (Turkey Bacon Avo) on Dutch Crunch to go.
The single scoop of ice cream was generous, as was the large TBA. 

Everything was delicious and fresh.

I agree with other Yelpers that this hidden gem in Noe Valley is better than Ike's! I'll definitely be back.
author: Cindy T.

description:
Was super hungry yesterday after some beverages at Fresca and Valley Tavern. The italian I got was amazing and did not survive long enough to snap a photo.

I give three stars because we had tried to come Friday and they were closed and occasionally the wait times can be high. 

The ice cream and sandwiches are usually good. Staff historically has been friendly.
author: David A.

description: This place totally deserves five stars, but I am a sandwich snob. For a Sub walk in restaurant like this, this place does deliver some quality sandwiches. Especially for Noe Valley that doesn't really have any just walk in easy casual food it's really nice to have Subs to just go grab a nice sandwich. Especially compared to the whole foods across the street who's deli sucks and is almost just as expensive. Subs is by far the superior choice!
author: Paula R.

description: Really great and quick sandwich shop.  I had the Italiano toasted and also a chocolate chip cookie.  The subs are really reasonably priced especially for their size.
author: Maurice O.

description: This place is great! I ordered the Pastrami Rami which lived up to its name. The employees are super friendly, and it's a a great spot to people watch as it is on a corner in a very happening place of the city.
author: Theo N.

description: I got the Matt Cain on dutch crunch and it was a pretty good sandwich. They usually have two sandwich sizes, but I noticed that the smaller size is essentially the same size as the larger one. A bit pricey for the portions, but people in there seem really nice.
author: Shabnam E.

description: My only complaint is that the owner won't name the meatball sandwich on soft white + hot sauce + banana peppers after me.  That's ok...I'll keep on ordering it.
author: David S.

description:
Ever since I ordered my first sandwich at Subs approximately 1 year ago, I haven't had an Ike's sandwich. It is just as good if not better!

Subs is the real deal, it's sandwiches are seriously top notch and the price is totally right. 

My regular is the Avocado BLT with Dutch crunch. They don't skimp on the bacon or avocado.

All in all, LOVE subs. Give it a try, you won't be disappointed.
author: Jennifer W.

description: My go to is the BLT w/ Avocado! Be sure to order the free garlic spread with it too! AMAZING
author: Jason Pierce L.

description: Perfect sub sandwich. I got the BBQ chicken sub with ranch... exactly what you're looking for in a sub shop.
author: Kevin R.

description:
Got a roasted turkey, it was delicious! Great meat and bread, I also like that cheese is included since most places charge.. cheese is just as important as the meat imo! Service was good and fast!

All and all, a great experience and great sub! 

..the only reason I don't give this place a perfect 5 is because of the bag charge.. If it's just gonna be something that automatically goes on the sandwich then include it in the price or eat the cost just as you do for wrapping, cause it's just part of it. 
But no blind charges, c'mon your in SF, y'all know how much people hate "hidden fees"!

That being said, PEOPLE! Still go get yo self that taste sub! ..just tell them no bag please.. unless ya want the bag..
author: Jeremy P.

description: This place is bomb af, period.  My husband and I are in SF cuz he had to have surgery and needs to stay here for follow up care.  The AirBnb we are staying in is close to this place.  I wasn't sure what to expect, I'd figure it was like most sub places with thick bread and a crapload of fillings, but this place says a lot more with less.  The subs were more like the size of paninis but totally satisfying.  The "hot sauce" wasn't what I was expecting considering it's more like a green chopped chili condiment(?).  Amazing nonetheless.  By the way we don't eat meat so I can't vouch on those sandwiches, but vegetarians and/or vegans should be able to find something that suits their fancy.  Hopefully we can eat here again while we are here
author: Jenna C.

description: Stumbled upon this place and was really happy I did. I ordered the Italiano 6in (it's huge and filling) on Dutch crunch. The prices are fair and the quality of the sandwich is worth coming by. I think subs inc. just might be on my top 5 favorite sandwich places in the city.
author: Reina C.

description: It was my first time at Subs and I got the TBA and my boyfriend got The Godfather. They were top 3 best sandwiches/sub we've ever had! Will definitely be back !
author: Sara L.

description:
Jamie W. and I don't make it to Noe Valley much. We love the neighborhood, but from where we are in SoMa, it always seems a tad more of a trek than our lazy derrieres are willing to handle although it's admittedly a simple J-ride away. That myopic attitude has been modified recently by this unassuming sandwich shop on the corner of 24th and Castro. Now sandwich shops are a dime a dozen, and I do go to Subway every now and then to get my BMT fix. However, a really well made sandwich is gold, especially in Jamie's book since he is a connoisseur of sorts. We finally gave it a try a couple of months ago late on a Saturday when we weren't feeling like a fine dining experience. Which is often, by the way. There are about a couple of dozen sandwiches on their chalkboard and then several options of toppings and such after that.

I was facing that Starbucks conundrum of making six decisions in quick succession and hoping for the best. I did good as I ordered the $8.25 Mortadella with Provolone on Dutch Crunch. I got it with the works: mustard, plenty of mayo, shredded lettuce, tomato, onion and Italian herb sauce (photo: http://bit.ly/1bLWinm). Now that was a sandwich. No art but so satisfying. Jamie went with the $8 Italiano with salami and ham on Dutch Crunch (photo: http://bit.ly/1zVjgDV). Same extras as me and just as tasty. They don't offer fries, but we really didn't need them. We entertained the possibility of a scoop of Mitchell's ice cream since they offer it, but sound judgment won us over after all. We returned just this past weekend, although truth be told, Jamie went on his own a couple of times in between without me.

He has become obsessed with the Large $11.25 Godfather, which offers the triple play of turkey, corned beef and pastrami, this time on a sourdough bun with the works including pepperoncinis (photo: http://bit.ly/1HbjvKV). I decided to try the $8 San Franciscan with roast beef and turkey on Dutch Crunch, again with the works (photo: http://bit.ly/1PfFWG2). I figured out it's the way they toast the bread that really makes it tasty as the rest of the ingredients are fairly standard-issue when I closely examined what I was chewing. They've really figured out something here that makes me think of this place in the same thought bubble as Lou's Cafe, The Yellow Submarine or Roxie Food Center. That's not a bad thought bubble to share if you ask me. And you did ask me, right?

FOOD - 4 stars...satisfying sandwiches lies in the execution with the bread perfectly toasted
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...it is a sandwich shop after all
SERVICE - 4 stars...quick but amiable sandwich makers
TOTAL - 4 stars...finally a food destination in Noe Valley we can rally behind without emptying out an ATM
author: Ed U.

description: I had an amazing Cuban sandwich here. The sourdough bread was excellent. One of those rare instances where the sandwich was worth the $11. They serve Mitchell's ice cream as well which is nice. My food was prepared reasonably quickly.
author: Will L.

description:
1) My review would be higher if the sandwiches were consistent. Some days great, other days terrible. They do certain things well and others very badly. As a paying customer, one deserves to order two different sandwiches and have them be almost equal in quality.

2) I never seem to get as much meat as they advertise in the pictures on their website. A common practice in food but it would be great if you were known as the place to order a meaty sub and always really drive this home. However, being the main sandwich shop in the area, I can see that foot traffic and convenience work well in their favor regardless of the portions.

3) Please, please clean your seating area and floors more. Your shop could pull in more business in a demanding city if you had a higher level of standard. San Franciscans expect more and in order to survive the economy, this needs to be catered to (as most very successful and long lasting businesses have learned. This is truer specifically for this neighborhood. Move this to the Mission and I would say something different. Go a little bit further in your staff training and your expectations of cleanliness and compare your yearly profits.

However, the service is kind and speedy, the options are diverse and classic, the ice cream is a nice addition, and the portions compared to prices are fair. I will be returning because what you do well, you do very well and your location cannot be beaten. Work on your shortcomings which are easy fixes and reap the rewards.
author: Brittany A.

description: Great sandwich. Well constructed, really good ingredients, and toasted just right. Prices are very fair. Highly recommend getting the spicy sauce and the garlic sauce along with whatever else you would normally get.
author: Austin M.

description:
That'll do pig. That'll do.

Nothing to write home to mama about, but it certainly does the trick. Pretty good everything, both food wise and price wise. I wouldn't go here if I need to be wow'd. I'd go here if I didn't want to be disappointed.
author: Chris H.

description: I've been a customer for many years. The sandwiches are delicious and the staff is excellent. You won't find a better sandwich shop in San Francisco
author: Jonathan R.

description: The subs are huge! Great value for the large sized subs. Came here on a Saturday and didn't have an issue finding a seat.
author: Melissa C.

description: This is an awesome sub shop, definitely some of the best I've ever had the pleasure of eating. Right on the corner of Castro and 24th street. Service is always pleasant and speedy. I get the hot pastrami with pepperocinis and garlic spread. Milkshakes from here are equally delicious. I personally prefer the sandwiches from here over Ike's in Castro. Can't go wrong no matter what you order from here. They also have a loyalty program where after so many sandwiches (10 I think) you get one for free. 100% recommend this sandwich spot!
author: Annette R.

description:
"The Best Subs In Town" - that's what Subs put on their big yellow store sign. Whoever thought of this marketing campaign must be pretty confident about the quality of their food before putting up such a bold statement.

While I haven't tried all sandwiches places in the city yet - I would say their subs are indeed pretty legit.

Placed a phone order before I went - when I arrived the sub was there already, and smooth checkout process.

[Pastrami Rami (large with dutch crunch bead)] - A-
"Pastrami, swiss, cole slaw, pickles, thousand island dressing" - this is the description on menu. Pretty generous on the amount of pastrami they put in; swiss was nicely melted and added some good smell to the sub. Thousand island and cole slaw enhanced each other's taste, and the sub as a whole was pretty juicy which I loved. Dutch Crunch bread was as good as it sounds. Pretty nicely done!

I can't give 5 stars to a restaurant who claims themselves to be the best in town based on one sub I tried. So 4 stars for now; next time I need to try their Godfather sub which I heard it's one of their signature subs. Until next time!
author: Simon C.

description: Awesome subs. Friendly people Subs are huge. A full size was two meals for wife and me. Dutch Crunch bread is great. Not much seating, mostly a take out place.I will go again when in SF.
author: Joe P.

description: Ok at first I was super put off because I wanted to substitute avocado for feta in my veggie sandwich and I was charged $1.75 extra for avo which is less than I pay for like a whole avocado I mean come on. And as a vegan option it kind of only seemed fair. The guy was apologetic about it and I almost left because it seemed like such a steep price but I'm actually glad I didn't because wow that sandwich was kind of a spiritual awakening tbh and will last me a solid two meals. I got the veggie and hummus sandwich but there were other veg options available. Had the avo been substituted I'd give a definitive five stars
author: Malia B.

description:
This place makes consistently great sandwhiches. I've been eating here basically since they opened. The crew is always friendly -- and there's ice cream and milkshakes if you need it. 

Check it out!
author: Dan P.

description: I have eaten here too many times which ain't good for my wallet but it sure does make my stomach feel good. They have a great selection of delicious subs. I can't believe the lengthy nasty review I read. It just ain't so. The owner who, I do not personally know, has never been anything less than professional. I live within walking distance which makes it too easy to get a delicious sub-sandwich. The staff is always pleasant and efficient. Kudos to this nice Noe Valley sandwich house.
author: Barry V.

description:
This is my favorite sandwich spot in Noe. Everything is made fresh and on the spot by the super friendly family that runs the place. There's a great variety of sandwiches and even Lettuce Wraps for those trying to keep their carb footprint low. See what I did there? ;)

This place is exactly what I WISH Subway, WhichWhich, and Quiznos were. You can't beat a curated menu, a friendly staff, and a perfectly toasted sub. The BLTA is a personal favorite--it hits the spot!

On a busy day, you're probably looking at 20 minute wait but it's WELL WORTH IT. There isn't a ton of seating room inside, but I'm usually calling in and picking up something to go. 

P.S. Ask for the hot sauce
author: Ashwin K.

description: Best subs in the city. Tasty ingredients, great customization and excellent signature options as well.
author: Jonathan S.

description:
Heavenly. 

You'd never guess magic was happening in this brightly lit, corner store in Noe Valley. Before discovering Subs, Inc. I wasn't a big fan of subs & sandwiches. I'm a convert - very glad I found this place. 

The menu is extensive, everything is fresh. There are a lot of healthy options . Vast array of vegetables, condiments and often, the owner Rami, creates homemade sauces. His garlic spreads are my favorite, actually the homemade cranberry relish is delicious too! The bread. Oh, the bread. Wow. Good on its own. I love this place. 

The portions are also immense, these guys don't skimp nor mess around when making food. Artists. We have these for lunch, dinner or grab a couple to take on hikes or picnics.  

Mitchell's ice cream is available, as well as homemade chocolate chip cookies. 

So good. Go try it out.
author: Carol G.

description: Good people, great subs! The bread was toasted well, the meat was quality and the ingredients were fresh. Recommend the TBA!
author: Alex P.

description: I love Subs Inc. The service could not be nicer. My kiddos always ask to walk down to get an ice cream there. It feels simple and authentic and unfussy. We love supporting local businesses in our area that truly appreciate thier customers. It shows here.
author: rosita t.

description: I'm obsessed with Subs Inc! I go there at least once a week and have only had incredible experiences with the food and the employees. The best sandwich in SF is the Pastrami Rami on Dutch Crunch. If you want an incredible sandwich and support a local shop, this is the place. It's REAL food - not the throwaway sandwich meat that you get at chain shops that taste like nothing. Subs Inc is legit and I recommend it fully. Whenever my friends come to town, they always ask to go there since I talk about it so much. Get the Pastrami Rami - I promise you - it's the best!  - Sharkman
author: Tom L.

description:
Very solid sandwich shop. Their hours are pretty good and prices are decent for the area (could be better though).

The sandwiches are very tasty and super filling. I come here frequently, and they have enough variety to keep things interesting.
author: Nick M.

description: Holy crap. I got the Pastrami Rami on Dutch crunch and it was absolutely amazing. I shared a large with my boyfriend and we were both perfectly full and happy afterwards. It was reasonably priced too which was awesome. I love a good sandwich that's packed with flavor and has ingredients that are spread evenly throughout and these guys did not disappoint. Highly recommend.
author: Kathleen C.

description: Nice but small place. Toasting on frenchbread was perfect. Good amount of meat as well. It is expensive 10 bucks for a regular sandwich adding cheese. But worthy sandwiches.
author: Danielle H.

description: Had the San Franciscan, Very good sandwich. Lots of options on the menu. Worth a try.
author: Thomas W.

description:
This place was great until I tried to call in an order and an employee repeatedly talked over me and interrupted me and refused to listen to or answer my valid question. Then explained her rudeness to her boss by making up a story about me swearing at her on the phone, and I was very publicly accused by the manager who made a scene. No thanks, I didn't deserve that.

Edit:
1 - If your employee cuts me off every time I try to speak with a polite-sounding phrase, she is still repeatedly cutting me off and that is extremely rude. You just hear her saying 'please' repeatedly, and not her cutting me off, and think she's acting appropriately.
2 - I was shocked that she had accused me of swearing and that was the first thing you opened with, which is why I was tense and serious. You're the one who opened with accusations, not me. I even thought there might have been truth to that and initially felt bad. But two people in the room confirmed I didn't, which made me realize how your employee was just giving you a reason to dismiss me.
3 - After speaking to my roommates, I tried to contact you via email at your contact at your website, and got an email delivery failure. Not my fault you have no method of contact besides yelp. Just saw a new website went live with an actual functioning contact page, which you did not have at the time.
4 - Falsely accusing me of swearing and having a store full of customers staring at me is making a scene. Period.
5 - All I ask is for kindness and understanding when I'm trying to get order. I asked her to confirm with another employee and she said she couldn't. And then I immediately learn from you in the store that you were next to her the whole time. She could have easily resolved the issue by asking you whether policy changed, which is all I was asking on the phone. Again, I remind you that this same phone conversation happened a few months ago with a different employee and at the time you didn't have two sizes of sourdough. And since then I have never been asked size after ordering sourdough. Trying to confirm information which had a different answer the previous time I ordered is not rude, and I was treated on the phone like I was an idiot, and in the store like I was a jerk.
author: Ryan D.

description: Order the Pastrami rami on Dutch crunch and thank me later. I love this place but the guy who takes my order every time is so rude and unfriendly. When you're in the food business it's also hospitality and he clearly doesn't understand that. But I do come back because the sandwiches are delicious.
author: Lucas D.

description: I got the Matt Caine, which was pretty good, but the lady at the front was rude and dismissive. I wouldn't recommend it.
author: Michael C.

description:
I got the Mozzarella Basil sammich. 
Let me just say that the sammich is good but the bread I got is too toasted. 
I was so excited to try a new sammich shop in Noe Valley as I live super close in walking distance here. The store was really hot though today was very hot as well. Anyways, I ordered the Dutch Crunch bread which I love so much since I am not a native SFer. The bread is a bit burnt and really hard on the edges. The way the bread is would cut the roof of your mouth. I do not recommend the Dutch crunch bread at all so don't waste your time ordering it. 

The sammich price is $8 bucks which is kinda pricey for a 'regular' but I forgot that Noe Valley is a bit more pricey like downtown SF. 

The guy who took my order was kind and the place kinda got busy after I ordered. I'm not a fan of how small space the layout is to get in and out and the ice cream flavors looked good. 

I would probably visit again but totally order different bread for sure. 

I'm so bummed that the bread is blehhh but I am glad I tried this place.
author: Star S.

description: This is one of our favorite sandwich shops in SF. We have tried a few of their  specialty sandwiches and they're all yummy - our favorite so far is the God Father on Dutch Crunch, and if you are into some of their healthy choices, try their house roasted chicken. The wait can be long during the day, so you can order by phone and pick up your sandwiches. Staff are very friendly. Would highly recommend this place.
author: Mina R.

description: Never failed me.  Customer service is always good.  Food is always fresh.  I usually order by phone and it seemed that anybody who received the call knows you.
author: Jun d.

description: Delicious turkey bacon avocado sandwich and Cuban sandwich. A hip corner joint open 'till 8pm.
author: Daniel R.

description: I work in the area and eat lunch here frequently. Always fast, friendly and consistent, I have nothing to criticize.
author: Evan M.

description: Work led me to the Noe Valley area of San Francisco but belly delivered me here to this damn tasty little sub shop. They have all the standard deli meats, breads and condiments and about 8 signature subs. Matt Cain is a friend of the joint and has a sub named after him and his picture on the wall and apparently lives close by. As much as I love the Giants belly wanted Pastrami. Went with the Pastrami Rami on Dutch Crunch. They toast the sub and mine came with Swiss, cole slaw and 1000 island. The oven toasting really softens the Dutch crunch nicely and all the flavors make for a wonderful bite. The pastrami is wonderfully salty and a step above store bought. Highly recommend!
author: Josh N.

description: The bread is fresh; the meats are also fresh and delicious; the garlic and/or hot sauces add a yummy twist to a traditional sandwich.
author: C B.

description: Fantastic sandwiches and service. I would highly recommend the Noe sandwich for any vegetarians who love eggplant- it's one of the best sandwiches I've ever had! So yummy!
author: Kaitie S.

description: The godfather looked like a popular one to try. Gave up eating bread, so was pleased to see they had the lettuce wrap. The sandwhich was definitely meaty, but didn't feel as heavy having the lettuce wrap. Will definitely come back and try their meat ball sub. Guy who took my order recommends it!
author: Sarah Q.

description: Great no-frills place, delicious sandwiches. The staff seem to work very efficiently. Last time I went, I had a regular sandwich with roasted chicken, and it hit the spot. I like that they roast their own chicken rather than using the processed cold-cut type. There's a restroom and a decent amount of seating. I'll be back soon!
author: Svetlana Z.

description: got the godfather twice here. solid delicious sandwich. no frills. im sure the other stuff is good too.
author: Linn L.

description: My husband was working in the area and I wanted to bring him lunch. I found this sandwich shop on Yelp and thought I would give it a try. The people there are very nice, it was quick and easy. It is a bit expensive for a sandwich but the sandwich was good and pretty big. Would definitely come back if I was in the neighborhood again.
author: Jessica S.

description:
Wow. I come to subs Inc periodically and just had the worst customer service ever. The counter girl was so rude. The owner was standing right next to her too. Won't be going back.

Update: I communicated with the owner and we discussed what happened.  I feel much better about returning to a great sub shop in San Francisco.  I will be giving them another chance.  I appreciate the owner's follow up.
author: A B.

description:
Great tasting subs! I personally could not find a better place in the area that could deliver great tasting and large subs like Subs Inc. It beats all the other sandwich places nearby. 

I usually order the Godfather or Matt Cain. It comes packed with meat and the sub is hot and crispy. I like how they toast all your subs and they come out hot. I don't think upgrading to large is that much worth it, because the subs are pretty big anyways. Never got a chance to try the ice cream, but kids seem to order it a lot!

I also like how you can order it online through DoorDash, so you don't have to go to the store to pick it up.

My go-to place for a sandwich craving!
author: Andy B.

description: Subs is the real deal. They'll customize any sandwich to your liking, and will be happy to do it ! Talk to Rami (the owner) and he'll hook you up. It's an awesome family owns business that serves up outstanding food and they can cater any event. Added bonus is they have Mitchell's ice cream too!
author: Sean S.

description: Good sandwiches, good service, prices on par with other similar sandwich shops.  They offer the Sub card which is alway incentive to keep going back.  I rarely eat sandwiches anymore so it will take me a while to get my card filled but I like that this place is close to where usually working.  Noticed today they have pour over coffee which I will have to go back and try. Also nice to see they have Mitchell's ice cream should I need a fix.  I thought they used to use Zoe's Meats pastrami but I'm not anymore.
author: Elvis S.

description:
The Italian herb sauce is so good. I usually hate house sauces for sandwiches, but it's really good. Don't opt out!

Also, it's seat yourself, and it was packed the day I went, but one of the staff members made sure I had a place to sit and cleaned the table off for me. 

I can't speak for the ice cream, but the kid next to me was eating some and he literally clapped at the quality, so I think that says it all.
author: Sam D.

description:
Best sandwich/sub I've had in a long time!
This place doesn't impress from the outside, I went there as I was getting seriously hungry and wanted to try a new place in Noe.
What a fantastic surprise! I will go there again for sure.
I still need to try other places in SF but this might well be my 'best sub in SF'.
author: Joffrey T.

description: Really solid, really simple sandwich shop. Huge sandwiches (enough for two meals if you order the large) and great Dutch crunch bread.
author: Justin S.

description: The sandwiches here are actually really good. I took my daughter here and she loved them. The place is small but the service is great. I really recommend this place.
author: Walkiria C.

description: They know my name.  They no my order and they make it right every time.   I don't even have to ask anymore.  I love the matt cain with no mustard and they make great shakes.  I get the mexican chocalate made with mitchells ice cream.
author: Thom R.

description: Awesome Mom and Pop local sub shop. Make sure you order Dutch Crunch bread with your sandwich!!
author: Jared W.

description: Best subs in SF. Hands down. I pride myself on sampling deli, and rest assured this place does not disappoint.
author: James T.

description: This place is just wow! I am generally not a fan of subs/ sandwich , but I tried the roast chicken sandwich and I loved it. All ingredients are at the right proportion, the more u eat the more u enjoy it. I would sure visit this place again and try everything they offer.
author: Vijay Kumar M.

description: Always get the Matt Cane on Dutch Crunch bread. It is great. Have been here many times and the sandwiches are big and really fill you up. A great place for lunch on the weekend, and on a major corner in Noe Valley, the best neighborhood in San Francisco.
author: David H.

description:
I was on my way to Philz coffee in Noe Valley and had planned to pick up a sandwich from the Safeway nearby which, in retrospect, probably would have been near the same quality and a bit cheaper.

I perused the menu for a good bit of time and I had finally settled on the tuna melt. The guy at the counter asked if I'd like a small or large and replied, "small." The portions are good. I'll give them that. 

I took a spot close to the front of the shop next to the window and waited for my sandwich to come. When it was finally ready, a woman called out, "tuna sandwich!" Immediately I thought, "uh oh!" 

She dropped it off on my table and I asked her, "tuna melt, right?" She wasn't too sure of herself either and said, "yea." The sandwich that showed up was a tuna sub where the bread was toasted, similarly to what I'd get at a Subway. I took a bite just hoping, by surprise, that it tasted like what anybody would consider a tuna melt. NOPE!

I took the sandwich back to the counter just to double-check with the guys who made it. They asked me if I had wanted a cold tuna sandwich instead. I said, "well, all the tuna melts I've had at other places, the sandwich came off a grill and the tuna was actually sort of grilled or hot." One of the guys responded, "We just put the bread in the toaster." I said, "Okay. No problem." Then I took my sandwich and walked away back to my table.

I am super disappointed, because I saw four stars for this spot before I showed up. That's super deceptive. I would not call it a "tuna melt" if it resembles nothing like a grilled tuna sandwich similarly to a grilled cheese in appearance and/or flavor" 

What I got was a toasted tuna sub. Definitely not worth the approximate $8.50 that I had spent on it.
author: David W.

description: Subs Inc. has the best sandwiches in San Francisco. The bread is super fresh and I'm obsessed with their hot sauce. We've been going there for 7 years.  I love Rami who runs the place.  He's super friendly and really takes care of his customers.  The vegetarian sandwiches are awesome. My only wish is a kids' menu or a smaller than regular sandwich size for children. Other than that, it's the bomb.  It's hard for me to stay away.
author: Amanda G.

description: I've literally had better subs at subway. Came in for lunch and wanted a meatball sub and they were out of meatballs and the bread I wanted. I was fine with that but then the second sub I wanted that the guy recommended which was the pastrami was out and I was offered no discount. I finally got a roast beef and it took 20 minutes to make and I was late for my next appointment and I was never offered even a small discount. This place stressed me out and I will not be coming back unless they change their ways.
author: Nicholas F.

description:
A friendly, delicious deli that's sure to offer a great meal and a good deal. I've been twice and both times have had the turkey and cranberry sandwich. It's definitely worth checking out. Be sure to order with Dutch Crunch bread. They don't skimp on the sandwich and you'll get a good meal.

Seating may be troublesome at peak lunch times as it's kind of a small store.
author: Andrew H.

description: We love Subs Inc. Because of the signature toasted sandwiches. Roast beef with a toasted Dutch Crunch bun with the 'works', there's no better. They also have eggplant for veggies! And, the Mitchell's ice cream and specially chips and sodas makes the menu just right.
author: Dani S.

description:
This is a solid, no-frills sub shop that I'm so happy to have down the block.  It's so much better than Whole Foods and you'll definitely be filled by a sandwich.  I think you could safely go halfsies on a large and be satisfied.  The service can seem slow at times, but they're also great about taking phone-in orders so you can pick it up and get on with your day.

My last dutch crunch roll wasn't my favorite so I've been sticking with french rolls, but I'll give it another try next time.  Oh, and the 'hot sauce' actually got kinda hot for me.  It's not a red hot sauce, but rather chunks of spicy peppers.  It's really delicious, but you've been warned.
author: Krystle S.

description:
Their Dutch Crunch bread is phenomenal. The large is the right size for two. One regular sized sandwich is pushing it for me. 

They don't have too many options however they seem to have the necessary basics on the menu. The BLT is probably one of their best.
author: Esther A.

description:
Just moved to Noe and we thought we would try this little sandwich shop by our house for the first time and it shocked us how good it was. We are so stoked to have a sandwich place that is this good so close to us. 
They also give you a punch card and after 10 purchases they give you a free sandwich. We will be going back often!

Thanks for the great food.
author: Rob L.

description: This was my first time there and I was impressed.  I loved the toasted corned beef/provolone on a Dutch crunch roll.  I also liked the fact that there are 2 choices regarding size for each of their sandwiches.  I opted for the smaller size and it was substantial.
author: Thomas D.

description: Great spot, had the oven toasted turkey/bacon/avocado and it was amazing. Portions are generous - took half my sandwich back for dinner. Staff is friendly and it wasn't too crowded during lunch time. One of my favorite sandwich spots in the city now!
author: Charles D.

description: This place is the bomb. 6 inch sub is huge and looks more like 12 inches. All ingredients are fresh and tasty. Subs are toasted to perfection.
author: G T.

description: Like everything else Matt Cain does the sandwich named after the man is perfect! . This place really  really rocks
author: Stephen C.

description: Honestly the best "hole in the wall" sandwich/sub I've ever had. I decided to order the San Fransican and the Turkey Avocado, both on their popular bread. Not only was I impressed with the taste but the sub was HUGE! I advise to purchase the full size order. It was so big I had one sub for lunch and dinner. I can't wait to go back!
author: Marlon G.

description:
This place has decent subs, but nothing to write home about.  

Plusses: Clean, bright space.  Staff are friendly.  Meat and bread are good quality.

Minuses: Overall, subs could use more flavor.  Veggies are usually less than fresh, which is a total crime given that we live in freakin California.  For some odd reason, they use white onions instead of red on the sandwiches.  Overpriced for what it is, but then again, it's in Noe Valley, where businesses fleece people left and right for mediocre food.  My biggest complaint, though, is that they can be PAINFULLY slow.  It definitely deters me from coming to this place on a regular basis.
author: Cersei L.

description:
Amazing huge sandwiches. Really wish I had one right now...

Their main sandwich has turkey and cranberry and it is really great. If you judge the place by any one sandwich, make it that one. Oh, and don't forget to get the "Dutch Crunch" bread. It's the best one.
author: Joel G.

description:
You steered me wrong, Yelp!

Walking by and hungry, I thought, hey, maybe I'll give this place a try so peeked at Yelp to see stellar reviews. And WTF? WORST TUNA MELT I EVER HAD!

Seriously, the worst tuna melt ever. You know what you expect in a tuna melt? MELTED cheeses, warm tuna, crunchy bread.... It's a HOT sandwich. This thing they gave me that was CALLED a tuna melt was a mediocre tuna salad sub on toasted bread. So the bread was warm, but the tuna and cheese and fixings were cold. Yuck. Also, given the season and SF location, I'd expect above-average lettuce and tomato (they're IN season), but they were the standard sub-shop bland.

I'd have given the place one star for the crappy tuna melt, except:
--Friendly staff.
--Clean; good separation of money from food prep, unlike so many others.
--They serve Mitchell's ice cream, which can be a boon for those wanting to skip Mitchell's lines.
author: Stephanie P.

description:
What a sub should taste like.

Two years ago I found this little gem and haven't bothered going to any other sub shops since. It's that good.

The store is set up like an old soda shoppe. Something you might have seen in Mulberry back in the day. They have tasty ice cream, shakes, malts and of course, those delicious hoagies!

I've only tried one sub ever! That's right, I'm writing a review on a very specific sub sandwich. The Turkey Bacon Avocado on Dutch Crunch bread is by far, the bees knees. Don't get me wrong, I walk in each time with the idea of ordering one of their other famous sandwiches; The Matt Cain, (a nod to Noe Valley's former famous neighbor) The DiMaggio, amongst many, many others. (maybe one day they'll rename their Turkey Bacon Avocado after me)

So, just go. It's good. They're nice and the price is always right.
author: Robert B.

description: I like this place! I have only been there once but the service was good and it's a casual place for an easy walk-in. I tried the Mozzarella Basil sandwich with Whole Wheat bread. I loved it. It's pretty big and the bread is super soft and fresh. I Recommend it!
author: Hiral P.

description: I think I found my new go to sandwich shop! I came for the first time today and ordered a BBQ chicken sandwich with cheddar. At first I was a little taken back by how expensive it was ($10) but the portion served was absolutely massive and was well worth the money. The sandwich, which I got on dutch crunch, was warm, sweet, and delicious. I highly recommend you try this place if you're in the area, personally I can't wait to come back!
author: Jacob A.

description:
I have now been here at least 8 or 9 times and now feel prepared to properly evaluate this place. 

Their sandwiches are really, really on point. As someone else said, not the best sub I've ever had but it's pretty high ip there. They use actual cuts of meat in their  roast chicken and turkey sandwiches, not processed crap.  They give you liberal portions of meat as well as toppings. Good and interesting selection of drinks. They toast these subs to perfection, it's pretty amazing to what heights that can elevate a sandwich. The dutch crunch is addictive. I don't care for their Italian dressing but their garlic spread is really really tasty. They tend to make the sandwiches kinda dry, I recommend asking for some extra mayo. High up on my list is the San Franciscan , the turkey blt and the roast chicken. In the middle somewhere is the meatball, pretty good. Last is the tuna... It just doesn't taste super good to me and I am a huge fan of tuna. Also their cheddar cheese is... A little weird. I would recommend going with a different cheese. 

Also their ice cream is really very good but I think they totally don't give you enough for the price. Avoid unless actually in ice cream withdrawal.

Service is friendly and great. Fantastic job guys.
author: Jessica W.

description: I cannot emphasize how much I love this place. The people behind the counter are incredibly nice, and they're always pretty cheerful, but the subs are really where it's at. My personal favorite is the BLT with avocado on dutch crunch bread. I've had a couple of their other sandwiches and they were all delicious, but this BLT is so amazing that I haven't been able to bring myself to order anything else since I discovered it! They also have a punch card system, where if you get ten subs you can have one on the house. Despite having several of these cards from many places, this is the only restaurant I've ever returned to enough to actually fill one all the way. I love it here!
author: Erica M.

description: Banging sandwhiches! The avocado club is crazy delicious. Get the regular size, it's plenty of food for lunch.
author: Eduard K.

description: Wow what a great sandwich!  I had the pastrami Rami and it was the best sandwich I've ever had. Love this gem in noe valley.
author: Tony S.

description: I loved my sandwhich! I got the Noe (eggplant, tomato, basil + maybe one more thing?) with added salami on Dutch crunch and it was so satisfying! Kinda pricey but worth it
author: Alisa J.

description:
Sandwhiches were sub-par and overall too pricey to be of good value, despite large portions. Services was pleasant, but we waited for a long time given we were the only customers. Ingredients were of quality, but preparation was mediocre and subs were very bready.

We stopped by for an early lunch one Saturday morning because Casa Mexicana down 24th St. was closed. We were famished, she ordering a six-inch pizza sub and I a nine-inch avocado BLT. Both were quite filling, but the pizza sub was insufficiently heated (we asked them to toast it again) and the BLT had more sauce than I was comfortable with (were not asked to choose toppings).

Not likely to come again considering far better options nearby.
author: Daniel P.

description:
I recently moved near this place with my girlfriend and finally walked in a couple of days ago. The first time was a little awkward as we were having issues with our CC and didn't have cash; it was late so we left.

I came in a second time a couple of days later to pick up a sammy for me and the miss and this time had cash. The dude behind the cash register/guy who made my sandwich was extremely nice and very talkative (I unfortunately forgot his name). He told me a story about a woman coming in drunk from the Peaks bar next door and wanting a sandwich. She told him she'd tip him well but realized she only had enough for the sandwich. He mentioned it was cool and low and behold, when he came in the next day that same lady had left him $20 for his services! Nicely done.

Anyway, on to the sandwich. I'm a vegetarian so we got the avocado and cheese with everything. It was very tasty, the bread was toasted just right and the cheese was nice and hot. All in all, with the secret hot sauce and everything in it, I was very pleased with my choice. The "large" is pretty big and filled up two people so the price is also reasonable. 

I think my only gripe are the choices; someone in an earlier review mentioned they wish they had better vegetarian/fish choices and I agree. I also think they should have a couple more bread choices and maybe even a pita bread or something.

In the end, I'm giving this place a 5 star rating for the service, friendly staff, and delicious food at a reasonable price. I was welcomed to the neighborhood and will definitely be a regular.
author: Erick C.

description:
This place is the best. Pastrami Rami is my go-to sandwich. Staff is super friendly and I love that the owner works along with them as well. 

This place gets extremely busy during lunch hour.
author: Joseph P.

description: Got the turkey bacon avocado on sourdough with everything but mayo. It's was yummy. And huge! Enough for lunch and dinner for me! Friend got it on Dutch crunch and also loved it
author: Beth E.

description:
Subs Inc. is easy to walk past on a busy 24th Street in Noe Valley - but if you're looking for a quality sandwich and local insight on the 49ers or Giants - this is your spot.

The turkey and cranberry sauce sandwich on a soft french roll is ridiculously delicious.  Highly recommend this spot.
author: Eric M.

description: I like sandwiches a lot, so was happy I found this place strolling around SF one of my first days after moving here. I got the Italiano (the old standard) on dutch crunch and was not disappointed. Small spot but was able to find a table pretty easily. I'd get here early though--I can see it getting packed, I think there's a school (or schools) nearby and a bunch of kids came in right after I ordered.
author: Dan M.

description: Best sandwich spot in town in my opinion. Simple, fresh ingredients nice people great service definitely a five-star place with five star food!
author: Nathan W.

description: Great sandwiches here! The staff has been friendly every time I've been here as well. They also have ice cream (never tried it though).
author: Patrick W.

description:
At first glance of this place, I was skeptical. The menu was limited and looked boring. Thankfully, I was forced to go, and I had the best meatball sub of my life. It was 5 star worthy. The Dutch crunch bread was delicious, as was the sauce, meatballs, & garlic schmear. Staff was very friendly too. 

My only complaint is I wish they had a bigger menu. 
They also serve Mitchell's ice cream here.
author: Meghan M.

description:
I love sandwiches. Why?

Because places like this exist.

Their dutch crunch is great, the sour dough was good. I obviously got vegetables on my sandwich and they all seemed fine.. The cheese I have found lacking. They serve Mitchell's Ice Cream, so you know, do some ab crunches or something before and after you go here. It's gonna be a hit on your calorie debts.

It is quite a neighborhood location, the owner is always around, the staff is very friendly, they haven't messed up an order even when they are busy... It's a well run location.

This is not the only sandwich location around, but it certainly is the highest level of quality with the lowest level of douchery I've had in the neighborhood.
author: Jeff M.

description: Used to be the site of Buds Ice Cream back in the 70's & early 80's. But we're in the present time now with a great submarine shop owned by an SF native who's employees make awesome sandwhiches. Try the Pastrami Rami w/cole slaw and thousand island. Most tasty sub sammie indeed. Crunch!!!
author: Sven S.

description: I was in the neighborhood and this was the first sandwich place I found that had a meatball sandwich (aka The DiMaggio). For most part I liked the sandwich although their sauce/cheese combo did have a bit of a spicy kick to it that I found to be a bit overwhelming but far from terrible. The Dutch crunch bread is great except I feel they should rename it to just crunch bread because I didn't find any weed and prostitution in it and as a temporarily cultured urbanite who was freed from his slavery to the mainstream, I was all about inappropriate cultural appropriation.
author: Ian L.

description: 1st visit so i tried the ever so popular turkey, bacon , avocado melt on D.Crunch. Outstanding!
author: Kilo B.

description:
Subs.   Duh.  Toasted.    Mexican coke.  Mitchell's ice cream.

Friendly service, but the meats are just meh, and they have screwed up my order more than once.  Maybe if they made the ordering system easier...  Everything should mean everything, including the pickles and spicey sauces and stuff.

bummer, cause I want to like this place.
author: Bad Y.

description: Ever since Noe Valley Deli closed I was worried I would never recover! But lo and behold, Subs, Inc. comes to the rescue. I am a big fan of their Godfather sandwich. It must be accompanied with Dutch crunch bread and all of the fixings. You can't go wrong with this sandwich especially if you're a hardcore carnivore! I'll give the other sandwiches a chance whenever I'm craving for a sandwich. :)
author: Bianca B.

description: A solid local sandwich shop. When I crave a sandwich and have nowhere else to go I usually grab a Subs Inc large which I eat half of and save the other half for later. They have a decent bread selection and I typically only wait about 5 minutes while they make it. It's not cheap but since a large is about twice as big as a sandwich I'd want to eat I consider it two sandwiches for the price of one.
author: Jordan C.

description: Best sandwich in SF. The godfather with bacon and a Mitchell shake. Very good service and after 5 sandwiches you can get a free one. Well worth it
author: Craig L.

description: I can't believe I'm saying this: the godfather sandwich is better than any other sandwich I've had in SF (spanning 34 years). Even better than Subcenter in West Portal. Damn, I just can't stop coming back. Corned beef and pastrami in one sandwich? Whew.
author: Jeremy H.

description: Typical sandwich place in San Francisco except they have Mitchell's and they have a great location! Came in on a Thursday afternoon.. Customer service wasn't outstanding and it wasn't bad -- just average. My turkey sandwich was tasty. Their Dutch crunch was incredibly good. Price wise is average. I would recommend to friends.
author: Neek W.

description: Lovely noe valley gem.. Got the godfather sandwich on Dutch crunch, it had generous portions and full of flavor with all the free options. Rami the owner was very interactive and personable. A definite must!
author: Tony G.

description: Seriously the best sandwich I've been to in the city. I always have to pick between the turkey bacon avocado melt and the turkey cranberry... So tough! Plus they have Mitchell's ice cream! I love this place. Come here all the time! Plus it's super close to my house.
author: Keenan M.

description: I was surprised when I read some of reviews, this place is awesome!  I feel like finding a good sandwich in the city is difficult.  I can find plenty of spots that have all the right ingredients, but they are never made with "love"...well I found my new spot, cause not only is the staff friendly, but they put a little love into the food.  The bread is amazing, especially the dutch crunch.  I've never been one to order a meatball sandwich, but decided to try something different on my 3rd visit and I was pleasantly surprised.  It was fantastic!  I have yet to be disappointed with a sandwich or the customer service.  Plus, I found out today you can add garlic to your sandwich.  What's that you say?  Garlic?  Yes folks, that's right, a bacon, avocado, turkey melt on dutch crunch, add garlic...I'm a happy woman!
author: Aimee S.

description: Nothing special but totally ok lunch. The Mitchell's ice cream tastes old, if that is possible.
author: Antonia T.

description: I loooove this place! the subs are amazing, the staff is really consistent from which I assume people like working there and they are super friendly. The ice cream they sell there is the best! Definitely a fan!
author: Marie F.

description: Best sandwich place in San Francisco.  I'm not a huge sandwich fan. Subway usually does me just fine.  The only place I previously out on a pedestal for sandwiches was in Waterloo, Iowa. Finally, I found one in San Francisco.  The Dutch crunch bread is so different and perfect when toasted.  The meat is not just regular grocery store cold cuts.  The only thing missing is dill spread, but that seems to be limited to Iowa.
author: Bobby H.

description:
I would have never guessed this place had such great sandwiches.  First of all, the bread tastes really fresh.  Second, they don't judge me for ordering nothing but bacon, cheddar, and avocado on a soft roll.  Third, they're really nice.  Today, I ordered my BCA on a soft roll and they didn't hear the bacon part.  When I meekly told them I had asked for bacon, they fixed it, no problems.  

AND they have Stewart's cream soda. *happy cream soda dance*
author: Marissa B.

description:
I'm a fan, and a regular here. I think it's the best sandwich option in Noe for sure. I like the Po Boy, the Italiano and the Turkey Bacon Advocado melt, all tasty. 

It's not exactly cheap but I've given up on finding cheap food in Noe.
author: martin l.

description:
I have shied away from being an avid Yelper due to the unjust and the terrible society inclination of coming and bashing every bad or unfortunate event that transpires between a consumer and a facility.  I have come to the realization that if I want change I must be the change and if I'm fed up of people rating and bashing companies unfairly, I must promote what I love vs. bashing what went wrong!

I love this place!  They have my favorite "garlic spread" option and a very good vegetarian selection!  Very friendly environment, quick service and delicious subs at a reasonably fair price!

Thank you Subs, Inc.
author: LoveAlways J.

description: I love this place! Everyone is super friendly and not to mention their sandwiches are delicious. I been going there for the past two years and I'm always amazed by how good they make my order.
author: Maria G.

description:
When I first walked in, I had thought this was a new sandwich shop- that's how humble and kind the owner and the lady behind the counter were.

Love this place!  The staff was so sweet and the food was delicious. I made my own Turkey sandwich with Dutch crunch bread but next time I want to try the Romi Pastrami!  They gave me a sample of the meat too and it was delicious.

The customer service was really indescribable. As previously mentioned, the owner and counter woman were so incredibly sweet and helpful, especially with it being my first time at this shop. Also, the place is cute too with nice folks in the area.

I would recommend this place to anyone and definitely plan to!
author: Tino P.

description:
When I first came to live in the Noe Valley, I've always dined out with my guardians on the weekends and ate at school and at home. I was on a holiday and went down to grab something to eat, and I stumbled upon this place, bought a sub, and I've been a regular customer ever since. I've been coming to this place for almost a year now and still have no regrets on wasting money on these subs, perfect for any day and just good sizes.

Whenever I have the Godfather on soft roll, I always like the way it's meaty with a good touch of lettuce and whatsuch veggies they put on the subs; too much mustard, but I still enjoy it.

Now the Ice Cream, first words in capital letters, is just spectacular. Mitchell's ice cream not far from me, perfect eating on a sunny day with a good friend of yours, chatting about his dog.
author: Bryan S.

description: Attitude Problem.  There are other places to go  on 24th street and Castro.   Wanted only a coke. Asked how much a small would be. $1.19. Great ring you up when you get drink. Got a small soft drink which was given to me at counter. When to pay the owner  I guess he was the owner. He  charged me 1.90.   Am I missing something. I paid. Asked how much a can of soda which was larger than my paper cup. That was $1.35.   They do not need our business. I am certainly going to let the business owners on 24th street to eat elsewhere.
author: Jay D.

description:
The Godfather sandwich is absolutely worth waiting 10min for. Its hot, melty and super tasty. What more can you ask of a sandwich?? 
I think the prices are very reasonable and the wait in line is never too long, which is a plus for those who got places to be and people to see.
Friendly crew too.
author: Randle H.

description:
For some reason, whenever I get sick/hungover, my comfort food is a sandwich. I really don't know why. But since moving to the city, and not living near a Subway sandwich shop (which was where I used to pick up my sick day sandwiches back in So Cal), I've discovered Subs Inc., just a few bus stops away from where I live.

My staple is a BLT with avocado on a soft roll with cheddar added. The great thing about this place is that they stick the bread and cheese in the oven for a bit so the bread gets nice and warm and the cheese melts and makes me drool a little just thinking about it. Altogether a great sandwich. 

The shop is very low key and the guys are not overly friendly, like most of the shops in Noe Valley which can be sickeningly sweet at times, even more so when you're not feeling well. These dudes are chill, straightforward, make your sandwich, give it to you, and you're on your way. I like this place.
author: Tatiana J.

description:
Yum.  Dutch Crunch bread with any of the toppings and make sure to add the garlic sauce.  It makes it beyond heavenly!

Really nice employees and owner.  They also have good ice cream.  A wee bit on the pricey side, but it is Noe Valley.

Easily one of the top 5 sub places I've had in a long time.
author: Kellan M.

description: Castro and 24th st. The sub I had was very good. I was surprised. They also have Mitchell's ice cream so +1 for sure. My sandwich didn't hold up in the fridge so go ahead and finish that baby off.
author: Will D.

description:
I just moved to the area and swung by here to grab dinner to go on our way up to Tahoe last weekend. The guys were really friendly and helpful with recommendations (I went with the turkey bacon avocado). Overall, the subs were really tasty and nicely toasted, though I felt slightly expensive for a sandwich ($7 something for a 6'' and up to $9 something for a footlong) - but I suppose the real estate in Noe is expensive, and they did take credit card (must have changed in the past couple years based on some previous reviews).

The cherry on the top is the Mitchell's ice cream! It was the perfect accompaniment to the sandwich - love the grasshopper pie. YUM
author: Erin Y.

description:
I am the kind of guy that appreciates a good, solid, not terribly healthy but oh so delicious sandwich.  After going by this place many times and seeing the great reviewes, I waited until I was good and hungry and finally made my way there.

First thing that I noticed was that it was clear that the owner was behind the counter (always a plus).  I asked him what a newcomer should order and he suggested the Godfather.  Given my great love of the Godmother at Bay Cities Cafe in Santa Monica, I couldn't resist.

Then, while waiting, two things happened that made me suspect the sandwich I was about to eat was going to be great.  First, after a little consideration, the owner mentioned that I might want to add garlic sauce and hot sauce to the sandwich and that they were both homemade.  Sold.  Second, every customer than came in after me was greeted by name and were obviously frequent customers.

Then, my sandwich arrived.  A measure of a good sandwich is how well it stays together despite being covered in many sauces, sliding tomatoes, and shredded lettuce.  This sandwich held together and now holds a little piece of my heart.

Incidentally, I was also blessed by some dinner theater while I was there.  One of the customers came in and had a 5 minute conversation with the owner about his disappointment that dutch crunch was the only bread available for a large sandwich that day.  I didn't think someone could have such a great disdain for dutch crunch bread.  I was wrong.
author: Darin G.

description:
With my impending goodbye to San Francisco, this is exactly how I wanted to go out:

- A sandwich as good as the one at Subs Inc., where the combination of turkey, wheat rolls, cranberry sauce and veggies magically come together to create something greater than the sum of its parts.

- Taking the sandwich to Dolores Park, where the temperature is in the 80s, the city sparkles in the distance and the vibe of the people is one of contagious happiness.

Fortunately, the goodbye is just for two weeks - Ibiza finally beckons! And as much as I'll likely never want to leave the magical white island, nothing makes me happier to know I'm coming back to the magical city by the bay, where many, many weekends of parks and sandwiches await. Preferably Dolores Park, and preferably Subs Inc. sandwiches.
author: Jason B.

description: I was greeted by a friendly employee. After taking my order and payment, I watch a thorough hand washing before the sandwich was constructed. Sandwich was above average. Good bread, good meat, fresh ingredients. The get props for having Mitchell's ice cream. Solid place.
author: Kate S.

description:
I really hate solicitors. With their chirpy attitudes and their screen-printed t-shirts and tell-tale clipboards, they are a major annoyance in my day. Yes, I support same-sex marriage. Yes, the oil spill is awful. No, I don't think the politicians should be getting away with it. But I've already signed your petition before, I'm too broke to donate money, and quite frankly, I'm fairly apathetic for someone who graduated with a Political Science degree.

I was on my way to Subs, Inc., earlier this week when I got stuck at a red light with a Greenpeace dude. After ten minutes of being nice and trying to figure out where I could just sign my name so he would leave me alone, I discover that he wants me to join the organization with a $180/year membership. 

Uh, excuse me? 

I quickly shuttled myself across the street and into the warm cozy Subs, Inc. shop. Bought myself a rockin' turkey and avocado sandwich. Having just moved from the Castro, where I was surrounded by solid sub choices (Ike's, Posh Bagel, Delano's Deli), I'd like to think I have pretty high standards. And man alive was that sandwich good. I raved about it on google talk, I raved about it in an email, I raved about it over text message.  

It was perfectly toasted - crunchy on the outside, soft on the inside. And it was full of tasty ingredients, lots of extra avocado, and I really enjoyed the vinaigrette that gave it an extra "POP!" The rest of the menu looked equally appealing, though if you want something fancy or over-the-top, you'll have to go elsewhere.

The best part? $8 for a ginormous sandwich that kept me full all day. $8 for a sandwich that kept me occupied as I hurriedly walked by the Greenpeace dude and back to my apartment. $8 for a sandwich that I'm already craving again. A bit on the pricey side, but my hungry stomach is one cause I'll always selfishly invest in.
author: Devon S.

description:
I don't really have anything witty or funny to write.  What can I say lousy service is my muse.

I got a regular(6") Godfather(turkey, corned beef, pastrami) on whole wheat.  Not the best sub I ever had but pretty damn good.  Good enough that if it were a few blocks closer I'd have to alternate nights I get tacos from El Gran Taco Loco  with nights I got Subs from Subs.

I picked up a regular Roast Beef sub for a friend, haven't heard what he thought of it.  But the price was right.  $15 for two subs.

My sub was about all I could eat, it left me full but not bloated.

The service was perfect.

They accept credit cards for orders over $5, I think the cheapest sub was like $6.25 so that shouldn't be a problem.

I was tempted for a few seconds to give them 5 stars, but in the end I just don't think it was quite the best sub place out there.  Not quite, but pretty damn close.  If you're looking to get a sub you can't go wrong hitting this joint up.

I'll be back even if I have to go a bit out of my way.
author: Max Jonathan S.

description: Let me just start by saying I am true sandwich lover!  I usually compare different sandwich places around the city to Ike's Place... and Subs Inc. is the first place that I think can compete with Ike's.  I honestly prefer the Dutch crunch bread at Subs Inc. over Ike's!  They also know how to build a sandwich correctly and quickly!  The tuna melt is sooo yummy!
author: Crystal I.

description:
Like mentioned in my other posts, I'm a pescatarian, so my comments are mostly limited.  

But man oh man, their cheese and avocado melt is beyond words!
They put this Italian dressing on it that is the icing on the cake.  
Whatever bread you get it on, which I've tried on 3 different kinds is always fresh and amazing toasted.  

The owner is very nice and the other staff is also very nice and helpful.  


I would recommend this place to everyone!

Oh, a side note, I think they also only take cash, but there is an ATM machine right outside the door, and a BofA right across the street.
author: Renae B.

description:
looking for a fantastic sandwich?  Look no further.  This place is GREAT!  Love the wheat rolls, LOVE the homemade garlic spread.  They are quick, friendly, affordable, and their sandwiches ROCK!  I'm addicted to the roasted turkey.  The boyfriend loves the Godfather sandwich.  Don't pass up the homemade garlic spread - it gives your sub a yummy kick that no other condiment can.

Try them out.  You won't be sorry.
author: Jennifer Z.

description: This place always amazes! If you hadn't tried Subs Inc yet you are missing out! WOW! Quality is what this place does!
author: Kris H.

description: Forget Rhea's sandwich shop hype.  Go to Subs Inc.  This is the best Sandwich shop in the Bay Area.  Customer service is excellent.  This place is clean.  They change gloves after each fresh toasted sandwhich is made unlike other places.  I could eat a sandwhich everyday from this place.
author: Shar I.

description: We stumbled on this place today for lunch while trying to kill time before going to see an apartment open house. Neither of us had ever been but I am glad we found it! I got a roast beef sandwich and my mom got a turkey sandwich and both of us thought it was really yummy. The toasted both to perfection in an oven and served us simple yet delicious sammies. I also bought a cookie which was bomb (not too hard, I hate hard cookies).
author: Alexandra W.

description: Best subs in town! Fresh ingredients, love the bread, awesome hot sauce/salsa, and a great, friendly staff!!! Everything I've tried so far has been delicious!
author: Kevin P.

description:
Now that I live here in NV permanently, I do have to admit that Subs Inc. is somewhat of a weekly haunt for me. Anytime I need a fix, these guys have it. 

Its seriously exactly what you want - a perfectly toasted, simply delish enormous sub for cheap. My below comments still apply. If you want something zany, go elsewhere. If you want an awesome execution of some old time sando favorites, come here.

The staff is super friendly, and always entertaining. I think at this point I've talked to them about everything from the state of my drunkeness to the state of my hangover, to the state of my lovelife, and the state of the future for alien civilization. They. Are. Awesome.

Eat up ya locals, and do it here.
author: Sean C.

description: Awesome sandwiches, fair pricing, really great staff!  Go hear a couple times a week and can't get enough of their Dutch Crunch bread!  Nom nom nom!
author: Jory S.

description: I always passed by this place but never tried  it till a few weeks ago. I really regret trying it. It was super bland. I can tell they use the cheap stuff, cheap meat, cheap bread, cheap everything. I can tell they are cutting corners. Come on it's Noe Valley, people want good stuff. Not only was the sandwich lousy the bald headed guy there who I believe is the owner was staring at me girlfriend really creepy. My girl whispers to me and says this guy is like freaking me out along me out and making me feel uncomfy. End of story:  crappy sandwich crappy sandwiches shop and if the owner reads this dude you need to learn how to not stare at women all creepy and stop skimping on sandwiches seriously! I will not come back until you have a little more class and make a better sandwich and I will come back.
author: Anthony B.

description: Subs inc is a great sandwich shop in Noe valley.  I pick up from here at least once a week and have not been disappointed.  I normally get vegetarian subs and they make them perfectly. It's not the cheapest place but everyone who works here is really nice.  Wish SF had more sandwich places but subs inc is the best I've found so far, and it doesn't involve waiting in a 30+ minute line!
author: Ben K.

description:
It feels like a good neighborhood subway spot with mostly returning customers.
The Signature menu of sandwiches are all very tasty but you can create anything you want.  I must if in the Noe Valley around lunchtime.
author: Kordich D.

description:
Went in last week with my kid.  Ordered two sandwiches.   One with everything, one with minimal toppings.  One with everything was fine.  The minimal toping one was totally messed up.  Kid ended up barely touching it as it had allt he toppings she didn't want.  plus they didn't put on there the one thing she did want.  We were already home when we noticed the mess up. 

One other weird thing I saw was that they apparently have a frequent buyer card deal.  I saw several people ahead of me get asked if they have a card etc.  Nothing to me.  I didn't mention it at the time because I was just curious if they would not mention it to me since they seemed to recognize the others as regulars.

Overall service was just ok.  Nothing special.  Decent sandwich but nothing close to some other places like Yellow Sub or Sub Center.  Plus those places have always gotten my orders correct.
author: D N.

description:
Hmmm. I dined at Subs Inc. for lunch today and it was quite the mixed bag. 

The menu choices look great; there's nothing unappealing about that. I went with the Cheese & Avocado sub, toasted (of course). The price was rather high for a regular sub (almost $7), and the large would run almost $9.

10 minutes later, I had no sub and an angry stomach. 

When the sub FINALLY arrived (keep in mind, it wasn't busy), it was good. Good, not great. The best part of it was the wheat bread, so make sure to include that in your order. 

Because of the slow service and high prices, I'll be looking for other sub shops for all of my sub-related needs.
author: Tom A.

description: Awesome people, amazing sandwiches. As simple as that.  Enjoy!!  I know i did!
author: zach B.

description:
The Great Case of the Sub Mix-up!!! 
My sandwich was accidentally bagged with another sandwich but all was resolved when they so generously offered to make me a whole new one. It was still not the best sandwich I'd ever had and it had that not-so-fresh feeling... if you know what I mean.
In the meantime I enjoyed a scoop of the Chocolate Caramel Crunch, it was the best combo of flavor, sweet and salty, and texture, crunch and creamy. 
Go for the ice cream.... we all love ice cream!!!

Thank you Subs Inc! Friendly customer service and tasty treats.
One might say it was sub par.
author: Mary Ella D.

description: Love the dutch crunch bread for the tuna melt. Highly recommended. Best deli tuna melt I've ever had. I loved it so much I went back 3 times in the first week I found it. I'd give them 5 stars if they had more fish/vegetarian options. This is a classic deli / meat eater joint.
author: Jeff C.

description: This review is for the sandwich and the nice, laid-back guys behind the counter.  I will admit, I walked in looking for a bathroom after getting lost and driving around for an hour and half from South San Jose.  The sign on the door said it was for customers only.  Considering it was almost lunch time anyway, I decided to order the mozzarella basil on a soft roll.  I was in and out of the tiny bathroom before my roll was put on the toaster, and rushed back to my car as soon as they bagged the sandwich.  Boy was I glad I ordered at Subs!  The warm bread was delicious, as were the simple, fresh flavors of the mozzarella, tomatoes and basil leaves.  There was no happier, sandwich-munching camper cruising down Market Street at that time.
author: Sherri C.

description: Don't let the generic name deceive you.  Strong contender for the best sandwiches in town.
author: Brian D.

description: This place was great! I was very hungry and craving a sandwhich while I was in Noe Valley. I got the turkey bacon avocado melt on Dutch Crunch-it was delicious! I got the "regular" size which was huge, I could hardly make it through the first half. Paired with a can of coke my total was $11, not too bad for how big the portions are. Staff is friendly. The only thing I will note is that it takes longer than expected for them to make your sandwhich, but I believe that is because they have very little employees working and many sandwhiches to make. The flavor was outstanding and it even comes close to comparison to the Barry B. from Ike's...yes I am comparing them to the godly Ike's! I will definitely be back, and I do recommend this to anyone who is craving a sandwhich and happens to be in the neighborhood.
author: Jena W.

description:
Warm 'n toasty turkey cranberry melt. Mmmm.
Coming from the girl who never orders cheese and always orders the brownest whole grain option, melted provolone and crispy-chewy-slightly sweet dutch crunch between which juicy cranberries oozed out, I couldn't have been happier. Must've been something in the water that day.

Ran $6.75 for the 6 or 8" stuffed chock full of goodies. The basic subs are $6.25.  Add $1.50 for the larger size (a few extra inches, not double in size). They've got a good selection of kettle chips, SunChips and other salty snacks. The regular size sub is plenty for a meal but you can nab the combo with a fountain soda and mac or potato salad for $2.75 more.

Better yet, save room, and grab a scoop of Mitchell's Ice Cream to go. They've got about 20 flavors.
author: Alissa A.

description:
I've been meaning to try this sub shop for a while and just now snarfed down my first (of many) sammich.  Really good!  I got the turkey, bacon, avocado on Dutch Crunch (another first) with all the fixins except onion - added pickles.  I like my sandwiches messy, it means they're not dry but juicy and saucy (added bonus that the bread was perfectly crunchy on the outside but soft, almost doughy, on the inside).  The mayo and Italian dressing were great together, added that zing most sandwiches lack, without overpowering the other flavors.  It was a good sized sandwich too.  $10 but the stuffins-to-bread ratio more than justified the price.  Will definitely come here more often.  Great small shop in Noe.

Also, got their ice cream a few weeks ago and it was creamy and delicious.
author: Arlie A.

description: Favorite spot in the city for a sandwich! The meat and bread don't get better than subs inc. and the owner is awesome. My housemates also love this neighborhood spot and you can count on your sandwich being made right, unlike a lot of other places in the city, that are also not run nearly as good as subs inc.
author: Jenn B.

description:
Not as good as Ikes, but still pretty delicious, esp if you ask for them messy :)

Came here with a friend after a 9  mile run at golden gate park, and was famished. I ordered a footlong meat sub - forgot what kind, but told the guy I liked my sandwiches messy. So he put extra sauce and crap in it. Really hit the spot! It weighed like 5lbs. The sandwich lasted me two meals.
author: Carol L.

description:
Solid neighborhood sandwich shop. I change up my order about every time. Can't really go wrong. The Matt Cain is probably my favorite, if you like a lot of meats. Usually get the dutch crunch bread. 

Service can be a little slow, but I think they just put a lot of time into making their sandwiches. Definitely nowhere near the wait you'll get at Ike's, and the sandwiches are very nearly as good (not quite the selection though).
author: Ben M.

description:
Good toasted sandwiches, I like the meatball. Mitchells Ice Cream in Noe!?! Forget about it. 
Can't go wrong here. Nice owner, same family owns Noe Valley Deli. Been going here since the day they opened. Noe needed this.
author: Matt H.

description:
The Good:

- The guys behind the counter seem like nice blokes. They got good customer service skills - right on!

- The sandwich bread was really good.

The Bad:

- I have a thing about hot lettuce and hot mayo - EW! I'm old school in that I believe only meatball subs should be served hot, but that's me (old). So I asked the guy if I could get my salami sandwich cold. He said yes, but then stuck it in the oven anyway. Normally that kind of mistake would send me packing but I recognize that I might not have made it clear enough that I actually wanted my sandwich cold AND he offered to start over, so I decided to let it be.

- Despite my desire to be zen about the hotness, I took the sub home a few blocks away and found what I suspected... wilted lettuce drown in a sea of melting mayo. The wilted lettuce was kinda my fault since I didn't ask for him to start it over, but the pool of mayo was uncalled for. Proportions are crucial to a sandwich and I'm telling you the amount of mayo they piled on was insane either hot or cold. There's no way anyone looking at me would think I need even a fraction of the amount they included. In fact, I don't look like I need a sandwich at all. Hmf.

- Pricey. A "regular" sub tops out at over $7. I wouldn't mind if it didn't disappoint, but it did. Majorly. I might consider Subs Inc. for ice cream. As for sandwiches - pass.
author: Prattle P.

description:
While I was eating my avocado and cheese sandwich today, I overheard the guy behind the counter (presumably the owner) talking about Ike's Place.

You know, Ike's Place, that all-the-rave-on-yelp, super-hipshtah sandwich shop in the Castro. The one with a zillion options.

Anyway, as I ate my sandwich and listened to this sandwich maker talk about how he just didn't understand what everyone saw in this new joint. The woman he was talking to laid it pretty clear: Ike's Place is kitschy, it's new, it's full of hot hipsters, it caters to vegans and the bread is just sooooo good.

Subs Inc isn't kitschy at all. It's your standard, good sandwich. They serve standard, good ice cream, too. The people who work there are OK-looking and they play the radio, aka, standard good music (they used to play crazy techno but I think the guy who always put it on no longer works there -- I haven't seen him in a while).

I love Subs Inc. I've been coming here for ages -- I suggest the Mozzarella-Basil Veggi sandwich -- but I wanna try Ike's sometime soon.
author: Elena C.
