description: Dutch crunch bread for the win! Also, prepare yourself for a large and tasty sandwich experience. I recommend the turkey and cranberry sauce sandwich. I'm sure it has a proper name, but I can't remember.
author: Elle E.

description:
After a wonderful dinner at Hahn's Hibachi. Teddybear need a  sugar fix, he want to have some Ice Cream at Mitchell's some days ago but we never get around to it because of his last minute christmas shopping....lmao. 

He keeps telling me to go look at the corner from Hibachi for we are going there after dinner...to tell you honestly, for a minute there I thought  it is some kinky store...because you can see the smile on his face everytime he ask me to go look and tell him what kind of store i see...again I keep forgetting that my bf has a sweet tooth and stores such as this makes him drool.

We ordered one sccops each, he got the mocha fudge on  a cup while i got the macapuno on sugar cone. I told the clerk to give me the whole one since the one that is on top is cracked. Clerk said that he will not give it to me and will throw it away anyway, TB got a kick out of me telling the clerk to just give it to me instead of putting it to waste.

Its Mitchell's ice cream, service put a smile on our faces...so were happy.
author: Malou C.

description:
Yummy! Cheap, non-sit down food in Noe Valley? They has it. The dutch crunch bread is really yummy and crunchy (not sure how Dutch it is).

I got a "small" toasted roast beef with everything yesterday for $6.50. It was huge.  It was also delish, altho you might want to ask them to go easy on the mayo. The guys behind the counter were helpful and cheerful. You can customize the hell out of your sandwich, e.g.., free jalapenos. Only sides are chips, but the sandwich was plenty filling.

Oh, and watch your step going in. I tripped over the invisible bottom step.
author: Tarin T.

description:
I almost cried when I bit into my pastrami on dutch crunch sandwich.  Granted, I was famished and so critical objectivity may have gone out the door, but this was a damn good sandwich. 

The bread was toasted just right.
The pastrami and melted cheese had a nice melt and were just the right temp.
The sandwich was not overloaded with all of the "other stuff," so it was actually possible to bite into.

I am definitely having another one the next time I'm in the neighborhood.  Note to self - Ask the owner if they have other locations...we need you close to downtown!
author: Valerie V.

description:
OK, class. I have an announcement to make:
Someone in Noe Valley is copying off Yelp's favorite sub sandwich place...FINALLY!

For comparison's sake, I ordered the 'BBQ Beef' and 'The Godfather'. The BBQ beef was smoky and given just enough sauce to tang it up real nice. 'The Godfather' was comparable to another sub named after the most distinctive feature of the 'USS Nautilus'. (educational-crack a book if you don't know it)

The sandwiches were 'oh-so-close' in flava to those found at a different port(al). Yeah, I know, you don't believe me...but it's true.

Subs Inc. gets a B+/A- on the sub part. 

Extra Credit:
16 flavors of Mitchell's ice cream earns this teacher's pet a full 5 gold sticky stars for their Trapper Keeper.
author: Andy R.

description:
The quest for the perfect sandwich - Episode 289

"Best sub in town" huh?!
I took it as a challenge. 
I turned on "Eye of the Tiger", did some gratuitous air-punching, and made sure my sweatbands matched my shoes...then i went for it.

I have been twice - both experiences have been great...perhaps not the greatEST, but great nonetheless. 

My first sando was the regular-sized hot link with everything. It was juicy (my top requirement in sub-sammie judging), the ingredients were of good quality, and the bread was toasted to perfection. I don't know about you, but sub rolls (whoa, that should be a new term for that pouch of fat that sits right below your pant waist-line - sub roll!) should be messy. They should crumb when you take a bite...you should be INHALING bread crumbs. At any rate...the rolls here meet my crunchy/toasted/crumby criteria.

My second sando was the BLTA. A drier sandwich, but still good. The redeeming characteristic was the bacon. Typically I like super-thick chewy SLABS of bacon on my BLT(A), but these were thin pieces. I was surprised by the amount of flavor packed into those little sliceys...total melt-in-your-mouthfeel. The flavor and texture was present in a major way. 

I will go back...it's conveniently near the Valley Tavern which has a great pub quiz on Monday night and is kind enough to allow you to bring in whatever food you like. Also, it's conveniently dimly lit...allowing me to eat my sando without concern about the lovely sub-juices dripping down my face and off my chin!
author: Jessa B.

description:
THE BACKGROUND:
Ah Noe Valley, I love thee. Walking through, I saw the wonderfully yellow sub shop and had to take a peek. The logo is cute and creative, maybe the sandwiches will be too. 

THE STAFF:
The staff was friendly and seemed to not hate humanity, that's a step in the right direction. 

THE FOOD:
I ordered a large tuna sub. They put it in the oven for heating... When I ate the sub I wasn't that impressed, the bread was ok and the tuna was ok. Nothing super fresh tasting or anything... No pickles that I could taste. It filled me up though cause it was pretty damned big. Seemed on par with subway... Bummer, my high hopes dashed. 

No reason to go out of the way for this place unless you really need Mitchell's ice cream.

THE BATHROOM:
Didn't check out the bathroom since I took my sub to go.
author: Michael S.

description:
Great local sub shop.  One that I hit up about every other week.  The folks that work here are fantastic.  They are always helpful and make sure that I have everything is made the way I ordered.  

I am from Boston and know my subs.  I am new to SF but this is one of the more authentic sub places I have found out here.  

Check it out and make sure you get the house sauce (they put it on be default I think).

Enjoy!
author: Ryan B.

description:
I just got home with one of these yummy sandwiches. A large turkey with Avocado. 

I think I like mayo again after having one of these. The bread is nicely toasted, warm, but not too hot & the cheese is well melted. 

They are a little pricey [about 9 bucks out the door for the large sandwich & avocado as an extra]. i was tempted to buy some chips, but they were $1.50 for a bag so I didn't. 

They also didn't give me the crazy amounts of lettuce, tomato & onions I asked for. 

They're good & they do have ice cream.
author: Rebekah K.

description: Big, awesome sandwiches! The dutch crunch was fresh and tasty.
author: Patrick S.

description:
Their tag line is "The best subs in town."  While that might be logistically true since they are the *ONLY* sub shop in Noe, I think it's a little misleading.  I went there with a friend yesterday and they screwed up both our sandwiches.  Even when they finally got it right, they still tasted like pretty bland:  I'm fairly certain the "Secret Sauce" is Wishbone Italian dressing.  

They get one star for actually opening a sub shop in Noe, and the other for serving 16 flavors of Mitchell's ice cream: the only reason I left the place satiated.
author: Julie C.

description:
My aunt was picking me up in the City after work to be ever so kind to drive m home for the weekend (2 hour ride).  She was also kind enough to drive me to 2 places to pick up some negatives and photo paper for my up coming photography class.

We were starving by the time we were done running around (during commute hour mind you!) so we happened to be in the Noe hood and wanted something quick.  Viola!  Subs inc appears!  There's no parking, so I jump out the of car and run in to order us some sandwiches for the road.  I picked up a BLT and I ordered her some chicken/turkey sandwich with everything.

They toasted the sandwiches and were friendly while I waited.  I also saw they serve Mitchell's ice cream ... yum!!!!!  The guy rang us up, wrapped up the sandwiches and bagged our chips and I was off.

I found my aunt and while we were at a red light, we popped open our sandwiches.  Alls I can say is YUMMIES!!!  Awesome BLT.  The bacon was cooked to perfection and just the right amount of mayo.  It was just good.  My aunt liked her sandwich too.  Plus they were a really good size.

We lucked out here.  I'd come back here again for sandwiches.  Plus for some dessert too ... I loves me my Mitchell's ice cream!!  Woot!!
author: imelda j.

description:
Who doesn't love a good sandwich? 

When you're in the mood for a decent sub sandwich, Subs Inc. is the place to check out.

I do enjoy the sandwich chains like Subway and Quiznos from time to time, but sometimes I need a break. You know you've been too many times when all of their sandwiches start to look and taste the same.  That's when Subs Inc. can save the day!

They keep things simple and fresh here which imo makes for the best kind of sandwich. Too much fuss just isn't as good.  The menu is small, but the taste is big. And they serve Mitchell's Ice Cream as a bonus!!  3 stars because they have trouble cooking bacon in the microwave (the 2 times I've ordered a turkey bacon avocado sandwich, the bacon has been undercooked and fatty), but 4 stars because the owner/manager is always extremely pleasant! 

Cash ONLY!
author: Ryan H.

description:
After grabbing a somewhat disappointing burger at Barney's, after being really hungry today, I thought I better come home with something, or Dusit Thai would be my last review.

This place is mostly for meat eaters, there are just not many choices here; even for meaters.  I tried a bite of a ham and swiss and I was under-whelmed.  Subs are toasted, but I was hoping for something more.  The meat did not have much flavor; tasting like it was packaged lunch meat product.  The secret sauce was OK, but more likely it was just Good Seasons salad dressing.

I really have to get out to Submarine Center on Ulloa, but I can't get there on time!!!
author: Michael M.

description: I got the Poorboy because I'm a poor girl, ha no because it looked yummy. It was a good sandwich, no complaints. Perfectly constructed sub! But also nothing I can't find at any other deli so just ok.
author: Karen T.

description:
Went here yesterday because I was starving and had like 15 minutes to eat.   You don't always make the best dining experiences under those circumstance, but Subs Inc worked out just fine.  I had the cheese and avocado.  Do they only have provolone cheese?  Maybe.  They didn't ask what kind of cheese I wanted, the menu says that all sandwiches come with provolone.  

The oven toasting seems to be merely novelty, because my sandwich was not warmed all the way through, the cheese was not melty at all.  The time spent in the oven was just enough to dry out the roll that the sandwich was on.

I know you're thinking, "That sounds awful!  Why still 3 stars."  Avocado!  There was an abundance of freshly sliced avo on the thing that made it all worth while.  I give puffy hearts to sandwich places that pile on the fresh avo - and don't even try to put the mashed up avo on my sandwich (sorry Togo's!).  And they put oil and vinegar on my sandwich.  Loves it.
author: Jackie D.

description:
This place wasn't bad, but it wasn't great either. They have about 3 or 4 vegetarian subs. I forgot the name of the sub I had, it was the one with mozzarella and pesto. It sounded good, but was kind of bland, you would think the pesto would give it some flavor because pesto should have kick to it, but it didn't at all. I did think that the bread was nicely toasted tho. They are conveniently close to CCSF's Castro/Valencia campus.

I didn't like that the guy who made my order didn't use gloves or wash his hands to make my sub after using the cash register.
author: Marcie L.

description: Not bad: had the turkey cranberry w/garlic spread on Dutch. Great service though.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
Though the price is kind of steep (~ $6 for a 6-inch), this sub shop makes it up by having a very friendly staff, Mitchell's ice cream on scoop, and a delicious roast beef and turkey toasted sandwich (the San Francisco) that has quickly become my favorite.  Actually, that's the ONLY sub I seem to get.  Hmm.  Maybe I need some variety in my dull life.

Anyway, only thing you could ask for is possibly more meat on the sub, but hey, can't have it all.
author: Chris M.

description:
I've never had a sandwich here, I won't lie.   BUT....

They sell ice cream.  The Mitchell's kind.

Sometimes, I don't have 30 minutes to wait at the Mitchell's Ice Cream on San Jose.  Ok, I do have the 30 minutes for good ice cream, I'm just not that patient to wait in line.

This place, there's no line, there's no fuss, in less than 5 I'm eating some Mitchell's goodness.  You can't beat that.  Obviously they don't have all the flavors but that's ok, in an ice cream emergency this place is a life saver!
author: Jenn A.

description: If the "Hunt for the Red October" was a sandwich then our fellow comrades would have build it at Subs Inc. The subs are huge meals where you have lots of meat on a big piece of bread. Yet its a good size that matches the amount of meat, so you don't feel like your just eating bread. The regular size sub can easly be two meals. The large size will be two meals for sure, maybe more if you want to make it last. I really enjoy the Poor Boy on wheat. They also have Mitchell's Ice Cream which is a SF staple. Just remember if you get the sub to go you may have Alec Baldwin looking for you.
author: Justin C.

description:
Exceptional customer service. 

This place is a great spot in Noe Valley to grab a sub. The prices are moderately affordable, and they have Mitchell's Ice Cream. I love ice cream, so that's always a plus. Also, the cute guy on the other side of the counter doesn't mind if you try 5 different flavors before you choose one. One thing that I really loved about the sandwich was the bread. The wheat bread was very fresh and tasty!

I highly suggest to try the mozarella sandwich and a peanut butter ice cream milkshake :)
author: Shel Z.

description: Inexpensive, great staff, and awesome food. I really liked the BBQ pork sandwich here, and the people behind the counter are always friendly.
author: Amber Y.

description: Ordered some sandwiches to go. Asked for no mayo. What do I get? A sandwich FULL of MAYO. We had to watch the world cup with a subpar sandwich. I also ordered a "pizza sandwich" which was luke warm -- the cheese wasn't even melted. I had to put the sandwich back in the microwave to melt the cheese. Good sandwiches don't need to be re-microwaved!
author: Lisa H.

description:
A mixed bag that averages out to "meh"

One time: not too friendly service but a meatball sub that was just fine.

Second time: had a great time talking to the staff while my sub was being made but the salami sub was uninspired and there was way too much bread for too little salami.  You couldn't even really tell that it had been toasted and everything about it was very blah.

My advice if you go: stick with the hot sandwiches.
author: Robert L.

description:
I had the meatball sub today and it was pretty good.  Fine sauce, stringy melty provolone and the bread was appropriately crispy from the oven.  I'm definitely going to be back next week to investigate the rest of the menu and have some Mitchells ice cream.  the staff was friendly too.

-1 star for calling it a sub (its a hoagie, yo)
-1 star for using frozen meatballs (I think, they sure tasted like it)
author: evan J.

description: Good but not great. They aren't really doing anything special or spectacular but the sandos are decent. They are open 7 days a week which is great for Sunday park days ! :)
author: Jeremy R.

description:
Great local sub shop. A little far from my place, however it worth the detour.
I tried their special sub with turkey and whole wheat bread. Huge, tasty and I had enough for a lunch.

You can customize your sandwich as soon as you mention it. You will find some details of what come along with any sandwiches. You can remove any items you want... because of course it is fresh!

Far much better than Subway for sure! No need to mention it in fact: D
author: Cedric L.

description:
Ok!

1. These sandwiches are one of the best in the city next to Roxy's

2. The people that work there are nice and friendly

3. If you have a sandwich called the "Godfather" you're  in!

4. Mitchell's ice cream,
  
but the only down fall is that its cash only!

And to the homie that pumps house music keep it going cause it makes me smile listening to music that I used to get high to and now it makes me enjoy my high on your sandwiches.!!!!
author: Matt B.

description:
Quality:
I ordered soup and a large sub. The sub was BIG, toasty and very filling. The dressing made the sandwich a little bit drippy.  The soup had big meaty noodles and one or two bits of turkey. It was also incredibly salty  - like something that comes out of a can. I could have done without it.  I try to support local businesses so I would give this guy my $ before going to Subway or Quiznos. 

Service:
A bit laxed. There was an incredibly chatty Cathy talking to the cashier (the owner?) when I got there. She was done with her order apparently but she wanted to socialize. I had to wait a while before my order was taken.  Also, one of the counter guys yelled my order and I got up and got it. No big deal - but the two other guys there got their orders taken to their tables.
author: Raul A.

description: Life changing...my favorite to get is the Godfather on Dutch crunch bread and ALL the fixings.. except mayo... I have yet to have a sandwich to top this one...
author: Kimberly P.

description: I always get avocado and cheese, it's amazingly delicious. I feel like it takes a really long time but maybe I'm spoiled.
author: Amanda V.

description:
Submarine Center at West Portal has spoiled me over the years.  They have coddled me with their great sandwiches.  And they have sheltered me away from all the bad bad sandwich people of the world.  My tummy was the happy beneficiary during this great period.  

So, this wee lad was totally unprepared for all the trials and tribulations, when he decided to venture out into the great abyss of Hoagieland.  Along comes Subs Inc with its wolf in sheep's clothing.  They have a nice little storefront at the corner of the block and they sell ice cream too! "Best subs in town", he said with a grin.  

"Ohh, me like sandwiches."

So, I ordered their large pastrami sandwich.  Wow, was I disappointed.  The bread was bland and it was still soft after being toasted in the oven.  The pastrami lacked any flavor.  And the rest of the condiments and sauce was empty filler.  I was full after downing that large hoagie, but my tummy had that ackward feeling, like "what the hell did you just cram down here??"

Subs Inc certainly does not have the best subs in town.  Subway and Quiznos have comparable, if not, better sandwiches.  Now, I'm running back to Submarine Center, with a tear in my eye.
author: Sam T.

description:
As a Philadelphia native, I'm quite familiar with the hoagie/sub so when I saw the sign "Best Subs in Town" I was compelled to see for myself. Verdict: Average. Quality of the meats: average. Roll: average. Condiments: average (they do have a secret sauce). That's what you get.

Also, they toast them like Quizno's and, if you do that, it's called a Grinder.

Extra half star b/c they sell Mitchell's.
author: Sig N.

description:
Hear, hear, Justin C.  The kind of place you go because it's 8:30 and you haven't eaten yet.  Oh, that and nothing else reasonable (under $12 for a quick eat) is actually OPEN in Noe Valley past 7:00 pm.  The sandwiches, while well-meaning and decent-tasting, are messy.  And rarely do they have all the ingredients I want.  (What self-respecting sandwich shop runs out of wheat bread by noon on Saturday?)

I actually tried to go here last night.  It was open (criteria #1 met), but I had $5 cash (they don't take cards).  They are clever enough to have an ATM directly next to one of their entrances (points up!), but it was out of order (points down), and they didn't seem to know about that (points way down).  So, yes, I could just amble across the street to B of A and get some lousy cash, but I was honked off by the fact that they didn't know (nor seemed to care) about their ATM, so I just went somewhere else.
author: Evan G.

description:
Subs Inc is pretty good for sandwiches. It's not the best sandwich I've ever had but it's great for a midweek quick sandwich when I'm working from home. 

They're not the fastest ever in terms of service but it's clean and bright there and the staff is very friendly. I highly recommend staying away from the roast beef but a normal turkey sandwich and avocado tasted great. They do use really fresh sub rolls for the sandwiches and if you ask for "extra pickles," they are happy to oblige... And we like the way they heat up and toast the sandwiches, it gives it a little extra somethin' when it's heated up... 

I keep bugging the owner to get baked Lay's in addition to the regular greasy chips they sell there - what can I say? I'm into the baked kind... so give him the same feedback and maybe he'll order some...
author: Heather F.

description: Has A Native Noe Vallian it's cool to have a great Sandwich Maker in the Neighborhood they make the best Pastrami Sandwich, Turkey and Cranberry. My Son Loves their Barbecue Sandwich along with the Pizza Sandwich. Look no further this is the place to be for a awesome Sandwich...
author: jerry p.

description:
Th eguy that owns this shop is the son f the guy that owns the Noe Valley Deli. The food is great and they have Mitchell's ice cream which can never be a bad thing. 
I love that they do hot sandwiches which a only a few places do in Noe Valley. The BBQ Beef is the best!!
author: JR H.

description: Fantastic sandwiches and friendly service.  Love that this sub shop is within walking distance of where I live.  As a vegetarian, I love the avocado and cheese melt (well, with all of the free toppings that come with it too!) on whole wheat bread.  Everything is extremely fresh and reasonably priced.  Already looking forward to my next visit :)
author: Rachel G.

description:
Subs Inc,  The toasted subs here are excellent: The friendly guys use all fresh ingredients in generous amounts, served on excellent bread, in a simple no-nonsense skinny store that reminds us of an east coast sub counter. In fact, my east coast brother actually drives up from San Mateo just for these subs. He gets one to eat in the store, and takes another home for the family. Is that east coast or what? Maybe being Italian is his excuse. He's jealous because I live only 3 blocks away.
Custom orders are not a problem, and every sandwich I've had there has been great. Never a screw-up! 

The mixed meat jobs are my favorites. The toasting of the sub in the small ovens is a new wrinkle that took some getting used to, but now I love it!  The garlic spread (you need to request it) is also a great, new addition. I already mention the great breads and ingredients, so now I'm finished. Try this place if you love sub sandwiches. 
Larry
P.S. One hour free parking is available alongside Walgreen's across the street
author: laurence c.

description: I've walked by this place for a long time and stopped in today and got a cheese and avocado sub.  Wow!  Best sub I've ever had.  Seemed to melt in my mouth and was bursting with flavor.   Will definitely come back.   My only gripe is that all their subs are toasted, even the veggie ones, and I like to save money by not toasting.  (If you heat the food, California sales tax kicks in, but if it's unheated and taken to go then usually no tax.)  But I'll pay the tax for these subs... yum.
author: Daniel L.

description: The avocado sub on dutch crunch wasn't anything special, but the guys working there were really nice, and it was nice to sit next to the window and enjoy a sandwich.
author: Mandy H.

description:
Enjoyed a toasted turkey, avocado, and cheese sub today. I wasn't expecting much, but was pleasantly surprised. My sub totally satisfied my toasted bread, melted cheese fix i was hankerin'. The bread was really light and airy. I actually could enjoy the sandwich without being overcome by the too-much-bread syndrome i get at other sub places. 

Service was pretty good. They were very patient, especially since i can sometimes be ocd and indecisive at the same time when i order food. go figure.
author: Christine M.

description: Fast, friendly and tasty! Great subs. The dutch crunch bread is awesome. Just wish they had a to-go menu so I could order for take out.
author: Y G.

description: Subs were a little tough but yummy.  Ice creme looked good.
author: Chauntay J.

description: Great lunch sandwiches!  Friendly informative, and catering customer service. CASH ONLY!  And to make it even sweeter, they have Mitchell's ice cream! Many flavors and they let you sample Many, before making a decision, without getting annoyed. :) It's Inexpensive and fast especially at lunch time.
author: Tiffany L.

description: Cool place with great sandwiches. Haven't had anything bad there yet. The selection ranges from standard but well executed salami sandwiches to combinations of unusual meats.
author: X O.

description: Friendly staff and the best sandwiches in town. Way better than Ike's, in my opinion.
author: Ian W.

description: Great people, good subs, and Mitchell's ice cream! What else could you want out of your local sub shop?
author: Joe D.

description: Love this place. Fantastic sandwiches and tasty ice cream, very friendly staff. I think they put crack in the mozza basil, because I crave it more than anyone should crave a sandwich. This is a regular weekend lunch stop for us.
author: Pat M.

description: Excellent subs.  A little pricey, but yummy.   Very limited seating, however.
author: Dan P.

description: I wish I could be as positive about Subs Inc. as so many of the other reviewers have been.  But today I had a sandwich picked up for me.  It couldn't have been simpler - Italian sub, hold the condiments.  But - my meat was rancid tasting, the roll was stale, no taste whatsoever.  Making an Italian sub tasteless is near impossible.  I've eaten at the shop before - the staff is nice and the food's usually good.  But this bad sandwich gives me pause.  I can't recommend it.
author: Tod E.

description: They have a great menu with a lot of great sandwiches, I personally have only tried the godfather (I believe thats what its called) which was excellent. The only downside to this places is how expensive it is, I paid close to $15 for a sandwich and bag of chips!
author: Ron S.

description: Warm, toasty, tasty, cheap sandwiches. They have all the standard sandwich meats (turkey, pastrami, roast beef, etc.) as well as some solid veggie options for vegetarians. The dutch crunch bread they have is delicious.
author: Evan B.

description: HUGE subs with HUGE flavor! They are on the more expensive side, but they fill up the sandwich with extras to make it extra worth it. It took a while to eat, taking breaths and breaks in between halves. Good stuff!
author: Haz O.

description: I just wasted $6.  Perhaps it's better for the meatetarians (tm Marsha Z.) since there are a lot more choices, but the avocado and cheese was just so blah.   On the upside, the interior is bright, there are window seats to people/stroller/dog watch, the staff is friendly, and let's not forget the Mitchell's ice cream they serve (Subs Inc's saving grace).
author: Marsha Z.

description: The regular size sub was gigantic; it could easily serve two people.  I had pastrami on sour dough and it was fantastic; the bread was crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside. Plus! They serve Diet Dr Pepper as a fountain soda.  I will definitely be back.
author: Stephanie D.

description: It's a little overpriced I think. Well I thought the ice cream was...I love the cheese sandwiches which get me thru my late night classes. And the staff is relatively nice, but people cut in line! Jerks.
author: Lauren S.

description: What's not to like about a sub place that also has ice cream?  The sandwiches are good, and the worker--at least the guy I've gotten each time I've visited--is friendly.
author: John S.

description: This is hands-down my favorite place in the city to get sandwiches. It's all about the Dutch Crunch! The staff is also extremely friendly and knowledgeable. I stop by every time I'm in Noe Valley.
author: Robin H.

description: Fabulous quality sandwiches. Friendly and fast service.  They also have delicious potato salad and macaroni salad, a variety of chips, etc.  Great corner to sit and eat your sandwich while looking at the passers-by on Castro and 24th Street.  They also serve Mitchell's ice cream which looks delicious, although I haven't tried it yet because I'm too full after my sub.
author: Len M.

description: These sandwiches are some of the best in town.  I don't crave sandos all that often, but this place changed all that.  A large can feed someone for two full meals and is only about $8. Not great ambiance inside, even for simple sandwich eating, so get it to go.
author: e w.

description: I'm really glad I decided to try this place.  Wonderful sandwiches, with nice 'nabe flavor.  Tip: call ahead and they will have your order ready when you arrive.
author: Ian M.

description: This place is one of my favorite sandwich shops in the city.  The subs are amazing- the secret sauce delish, the rolls- warm, chewy and sooooo good.  I just took my boyfriend and his concurred- this place is hands down WORTH a try.  Try the roasted turkey sub- you won't be disappointed.  Enjoy!!!
author: AJ L.

description: Not only do they have stellar subs, they have Mitchells Ice Cream.  Great family owned neighborhood business with excellent service.You gotta try it!
author: Karen J.

description: Tasty, convenient, good sandwich options, cheap, friendly staff, and AWESOME ice cream. The coconut ice cream is crazy good! Wish they were open past 8pm AND that they took plastic, but I can deal!
author: Jennifer C.

description:
so...the son of "noe valley deli" has opened his own sandwich place!!! sweet!!!
i tried their regular bbq beef for $5.99 and it was appetizing and well-prepared. they oven toasted their french bread and it has a good crunch on the outside and it's soft on the inside. amazingly, they also serve mitchell's ice cream and they have my 2 favorite flavors: mango and kahlua mocha!!!!...
author: Nelle A.

description: If you're in Noe and have a craving for toasty Quizno's goodness, well, you're probably going to be disappointed.  Quizno's hasn't yet infiltrated the yuppified realm of Noe, and it probably never will, due to local zoning restrictions.  If you're in the mood for a passable imitation of a Quizno's toasted Sub, Subs Inc.  will take care of you.  Totally unremarkable... but just about any sub can be made tasty by toasting it, which Subs Inc. does to all of its subs.  I mean, you could pour a cup of Purina Cat Chow between two slices of bread and I'd probably consider eating it if you popped it in an oven.  Well probably not.  But you get my point.
author: Andrew E.

description: I'm super picky when it comes to my subs, and this place passed with flying colors.  I can only speak of the turkey/avocado, but the combination of their bread, the turkey/avocado, and whatever dressing they put on there, I couldn't get enough!
author: Jenn K.

description: Sub sandwiches and ice cream in the same shop. Score. Usually only come in for sandwiches but each time, either me or my companion is overwhelmed by an urge for some ice cream goodness. I love the roast beef sandwich they have here, as well as the cookies 'n cream ice cream.
author: Julia B.

description: Yummy toasted subs and Mitchell's ice cream. So-so customer service.
author: Shannon B.

description: I may not have bothered to review Subs Inc if it weren't for the ice-cream... they serve Mitchell's ice-cream (possibly the best ice-cream in the whole wide world) at ridiculously low prices: $2.75 for a huge scoop in a cone?! Sold! I stopped there to get a soda in the afternoon but couldn't resist when I saw that. I went for the mocha fudge... sooo yummy. Besides the ice-cream: pretty standard sandwich joint (but I have yet to try the sandwiches).
author: David S.

description: Quality sandwiches, Mitchell's ice cream, and friendly staff...what more can you ask for? I live very close by, so I'm a regular. Sometimes I get major cravings for grasshopper pie ice cream and pick up a whole pint.
author: Jenny R.

description: I tried both the BBQ Beef and a Smoked Turkey Sandwich. For a girl who grew up on ToGo's, both were unsatisfying and quite honestly, bland.  And their "Special Sauce"?  Italian Dressing.  One extra star for doing the right thing and opening a sandwich spot in the Noe.
author: Grave Y.

description: Currently eating a turkey sandwich with avocado on wheat.  I honestly just needed a quick bite and it turned out to be a GREAT find! The bread is perfectly toasted and the insides just a tiny bit warm.  Also, the guy washed his hands two different times while making the sandwich (after taking my order and again after handling cash).  I WILL be back!
author: Shantal M.

description: i came in here on a saturday afternoon for a late lunch and got a turkey sandwich.  it was simple and fresh.  the wheat bun was toasted and i dont know why i thought it was weird that i thought i got two tops for the bun.  anyways ... the sandwich was good.
author: claudia y.

description: Yum!  Get the "san franciscan" with avocados.  Yum.  The meatball sub is also top of my list.  Friendly peeps.
author: babsie g.

description: Sub inc. comes into play when it's 8:30PM and you haven't had dinner, and you're too lazy to whip something up yourself.  I'm actually glad it's there for circumstances that I like to call "convenience".  It's never a place I crave, but the sandwiches aren't that bad that you won't eat them.  The marketing is genius!  It got your ass in there, eh!
author: Justin C.

description:
With a city that has so many great options, who gives this place higher than a one star.  I wandered into this place last week looking for a quick bite-boy I was disappointed.  This place SUCKS!!!!!!!

I got the turkey avocado, and it was dry, bland.  You can tell that the quality of the meat they use is probably sub par.  I just cant believe people give this place some decent reviews, I guess its because its the only option in the neighborhood.  

The ambiance was cheesy and the service was lack luster.  I'll give them another shot one day, who knows if it will be soon.
author: Matt M.

description: Good hot sandwiches. Also have Mitchell's ice cream. LOVE the grasshopper ice cream (mint chocolate). Great place to stop for a bite in Noe.
author: julie q.

description: The sandwich is perfect! If you want a large sandwich that is amazing you have to come here! The quality is really good and the best that ive had in the city hands down.
author: Melissa M.

description:
Simple, it's 5 stars if you order the turkey/avocado/bacon or the godfather hands down, imo. I've not had much luck with the other stuff on the menu but once you've had those two it's hard to order anything else anyway. 

P.S. the spicy sauce on the godfather is awesome and can be had in addition on the side for extra kick.
author: Michael G.

description: Best Subs in Town eh? Let the people be the judge of that please. The whole culinary experience was average at best. If you need a sandwich in Noe Valley this is as good as any of the other places close by but it was a far cry from the best sub in town.
author: Jimmy G.

description: Perfect lunch.  I had the Italiano.  I love fresh bread.  And they hit the nail on the head.  Another thing I noticed.  The floors polished to a high gleam.  High ceilings.  Roomy space.    Love the area.  Noe Valley is brilliant.
author: Nick T.

description:
Great subs and friendly service!  The guys at the counter remember you (I guess that means we are in pretty often).  The bread is great and they have plenty of interesting sandwich options.  Follow it up with some great Mitchell's ice cream and it makes for a nice and quick lunch or dinner out.

The large is enough for two if you're not super hungry.

Try the mozzarella sandwich - I keep coming back for it.
author: D H.

description: open till 8pm every day, if you're in the mood for a good sandwich for an early dinner, this is your place. add the hot sauce to your sandwich, it adds just the right touch.
author: audra k.

description: Great Noe Valley neighbood sandwich stop. Whole menu is fantastic. Toasted bread , everything fresh.  Very comfortable to eat there and take in sounderings. Four stars!!
author: Frank H.

description: i love these guys!! when ever im in the mood for a damn ass good toasted sandwich this is were i go!! go see  neil he's hella cool lol!! but for real the subs and mitchells ice cream is to die for!!!!!!
author: Shauna P.

description: I enjoy Subs Inc. The staff there is always extremely friendly and the subs are tasty. If you are in Noe Valley, check it out. They now take credit cards which is a plus in my book.
author: Lauren G.

description: These sandwiches are great. The house-made hot sauce is a must. And, the lunch special is a winner with house-made potato or macaroni salad. I really dig the food here.
author: Paul N.

description: dang! noe valley needed a place like this. relatively cheap, fast, and good sandwiches. nothing fancy but they use proper ingredients, the veggies are fresh and the way they toast their subs is just right, not too crispy and not too soft.
author: andy c.

description: fresh ingredients served on warm toasted bread!  i recommend the Italiano on dutch.  yummilicous!  my work place serves me the finest sushi, organic produce, and the choicest cuts of meats on a daily basis... for free .. motivation for me to work from home on occasion is the italiano!
author: Victoria F.

description: no doubt about it, this place makes great subs.  the roasted turkey, avocado and cheese veggie melt, and the mozzarella/pesto are my three favorites, but i have to imagine the rest of the menu is just as good.  their fresh ingredients and choice of rolls, which they toast to perfection, make all the difference.  plus, the guys who work here are friendly and nice - the only draw back is that when they are busy, it takes a while - nevertheless, its worth the wait.
author: Erin C.

description:
My husband and I are huge hot sub fans, schooled in the excellence that is Pot Belly's (a Chicago institution).  Here in SF, we have made do with three places to get our fix: Marina Subs (excellent, but often crowded and far for us), Viking Sub (decent and less crowded, but bad parking situation), and the relatively new Toaster Oven (a Pot Belly copy, and a good one at that).  Alas, there was nothing in our neighborhood that came close to making a great sandwich.  You can imagine my excitement when I saw the sign go up for Subs, Inc. -- I just knew it had hot subs written all over it.  And sure enough, as we found out on opening day, the sandwiches are all given their time in a little oven.  The actual execution is not quite up to Marina Subs or Toaster Oven, but it is still a much welcomed place.  The Poor Boy could use slightly more toasting and the Avocado and Cheese could use some more ingredients (see Marina Subs for guide).  The employees and owners are super nice and the prices right.  Also, open pretty late for a sub shop -- a very good thing.

Thanks for moving into the neighborhood!!!  We look forward to many, many meals.

Bottom Line: Yummy, if not perfect, hot subs come to Noe Valley!
author: L G.

description: Good solid sandwich shop.  Bread is good and topings are good and who's going to say no to a toasty melty sub?
author: Jane M.

description: the sandwiches are good and they know what they're doing here.  Friendly, fast service.  I have nothing to complain about here.  Very casual and basic fast food restaurant-esque ambiance.
author: pauline e.

description: i went hear for ice cream after dinner one nite and it was for sure not the best, but the subs looked very good. theres a lot of cool stores in noe valley so this is a good place to fuel up.
author: avery N.
